New Records: Corey Seager becomes just the fourth player ever to win the Fall Classic honor multiple times.
Key Match Events: Seager broke up Zac Gallen's no-hit bid with a leadoff single in the seventh inning of Game 5.
He then scored what proved to be the deciding run on a single from Mitch Garver.
With Texas trailing by two in the bottom of the ninth in Game 1, Seager crushed a two-run homer off closer Paul Sewald.
In Game 3, Seager padded the Rangers' early lead with a two-run homer in the third inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Seager, who also won the 2020 World Series MVP award as a member of the Los Angeles Dodgers, becomes just the fourth player ever to win the Fall Classic honor multiple times.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series championship in franchise history by defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks 4-1 in the series.
Seager left Los Angeles for Texas ahead of the 2022 season, signing a monster 10-year, $325 million deal with the Rangers.
